summary: This is an email chain regarding the filing of Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure. Attorney Marc Fernich informs the recipient (likely a prosecutor) that there was a slight delay because the client (Epstein) was not produced for review earlier that morning, and hard copies are being delivered.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: Attorney sending an email to inform about a delay in filing and serving Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure, stating hard copies are being delivered.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc'd) on the email regarding the Epstein financial disclosure filing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the 'Client' who was not produced for visitation, review, and approval of his financial disclosure earlier on the morning of July 12, 2019.

connections.description: Marc Fernich is handling the filing of Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure as his attorney.
Fernich is communicating with Weinberg (likely another legal professional) regarding the status of the Epstein financial disclosure filing.

events.title: Delay in Epstein Financial Disclosure Filing
events.description: Attorney Marc Fernich emails to explain a slight delay in filing and serving Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure because Epstein was not produced for review and approval earlier that morning.

locations: 810 Seventh Ave. Ste. 620 New York, NY 10019
keyFacts: On July 12, 2019, attorney Marc Fernich communicated a delay in filing Jeffrey Epstein's financial disclosure.
The delay was attributed to Epstein not being 'produced for visitation, review and approval earlier this morning,' indicating he was in custody or detention.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal proceedings requiring Epstein's financial disclosure around the time of his 2019 arrest.
